data.title: Friends legend Matt LeBlanc has split from girlfriend Andrea Anders after more than eight years together
data.meta_description: Matt's spokesperson told Us Weekly that the couple "decided to end things some time ago"
data.text:
Friends star Matt LeBlanc has split from his partner of almost a decade.

The fun-loving comedian, 47, and his partner Andrea Anders have called time on their eight-year relationship.

Matt's spokesperson told Us Weekly that the couple "decided to end things some time ago".

The pair first stepped out together in 2006, shortly after Matt split from his wife of three years, Melissa McKnight.

They met on the set of his Friends spin-off show, Joey.

On Monday, Matt attended his LA premiere of Episodes solo.

Matt and Andrea were last seen together in August when they walked the Emmy red carpet together.

In October, the actor was reportedly seen flirting with a nightclub blonde.

At the time his rep dismissed rumours he had been flirting.

Mirror Celeb have contacted Matt's rep for comment.
